page.title: 03ST AUBIN'S FORT
page.content: St. Aubin's Fort is a small walled fortification 500 metres off shore in St. Aubin's Bay. The first fort was built in 1542. In the beginning it served to protect the harbour from pirates, and in later years was developed as part of the island defences during the many Franco English wars. Major alterations were made in the 19th C. and during the Occupation of Jersey, 1940-45, the Germans added concrete bunkers and gun emplacements. Since then it has been used as a field study centre for the island schools. A classroom has been built within the walls, and the keep converted to domestic quarters. It is equipped with bottle gas, water supplied by tanker, and a diesel generator to supply electricity.
